products.title: Brew Note Market Tote
products.body_html: We’ve designed this tote bag to be perfect for farmers market trips, record store digs, and larger grocery hauls. Made from a soft canvas material and featuring a graphic that artfully nods to the immersive fruit-forward sensory experiences in specialty coffee.

products.title: Black Cat Project Cappuccino Cup
products.body_html: You'll feel extra fancy drinking from this precise 5oz cappuccino cup. It allows for an ideal ratio between espresso and milk. Everything from the balance of the cup when held, the handle, and the smooth bowl-shaped interior base makes this espresso experience absolute perfection. Saucer included.

products.title: Black Cat Project Latte Cup Large
products.body_html: The result of three years of R&D in collaboration with Los Angeles design firm NotNeutral. Every aspect of this 12oz cup has been measured, weighed, and exhaustively tested through dozens of iterations to achieve a design that is both practical and stylish. Saucer included.

products.title: Instant Espresso Black Cat Classic
products.body_html: Introducing our new Instant Espresso Black Cat Classic! A new freeze-dried instant coffee with notes of dark chocolate, raw sugar and marshmallow based on our best-selling signature espresso blend. Simply pour the instant espresso into your cup, add hot or cold water or milk of your choice, stir & enjoy. Great while traveling, on-the-go, or to enjoy that great espresso taste without the fancy equipment. You can even use it to make a macchiato, cappuccino, americano, or latte at home! Each box contains five individual servings.
tags: Black Cat Classic + Instant Latte Bundle: 2
Nano Foamer Frother + Instant Variety Bundle: 5

products.title: Instant Coffee House Blend
products.body_html: We've teamed up with Swift Cup Coffee to bring you an instant coffee with quality in mind. Try our Intelligentsia House Blend instantly with just 8oz of hot or cold water! This 5 pack of single-servings is perfect when traveling or on-the-go.
tags: Nano Foamer Frother + Instant Variety Bundle: 5

products.title: Baratza Encore ESP
products.body_html: The Encore ESP seamlessly handles both filter and espresso grinds with a unique adjustment mechanism that allows precise fine-tuning below 20 on the dial. Whether for filter coffee, espresso, or both, the Encore ESP is an excellent choice.

products.title: Colombia La Laja Geisha 7oz
products.body_html: After being hand-picked in the morning, only the perfectly ripe Geisha cherries were selected and pulped in the afternoon before undergoing a 48-hour fermentation in open-air tanks.

products.title: Colombia Red Striped Bourbon
products.body_html: An exciting variety - fermented with restraint, maintaining the identity of the country, region, clean process, and variety.

products.title: Rwanda Murundo People's Farm
products.body_html: Grown by small-scale farmers in the volcanic soil surrounding Lake Kivu.

products.title: Kenya Faith Estate 7oz
products.body_html: By processing their coffees at a centralized location, Faith Estate farmers benefit from improved infrastructure and more precise protocols, allowing them to develop the highest quality possible.

products.title: Peru La Palestina Juan Alarcón
products.body_html: Finca La Palestina is a thriving operation, home to three generations of the Alarcón Coronel family who collectively manage the farm under a shared vision of quality.

products.title: Colombia Juan Martín Arara
products.body_html: This coffee is something altogether different — a single variety selection from Finca Juan Martín, an experimental farm where Banexport works to identify the best growing and post-harvest practices for each of the varieties it has planted.

products.title: Guatemala SL-28
products.body_html: Inspired by the renowned SL-28 variety commonly grown in Kenya, he planted these seeds at La Maravilla to explore how they would adapt to its unique terroir.

products.title: Guatemala Ethiopia Landrace
products.body_html: La Maravilla, perched in the rugged mountains of Huehuetenango, lives up to its name, which means "marvel" in Spanish.

products.title: Guatemala La Soledad H1 SOE
products.body_html: The Pérez family started growing coffee at Finca La Soledad in Acatenango in the 19th century, but their approach is strictly 21st-century modern.
tags: Origin Story: Guatemala La Soledad H1

products.title: Ethiopia Kirite Washed
products.body_html: An elegant coffee with floral aromatics and notes of fresh peach, sweet meyer lemon, and hibiscus.

products.title: Ethiopia Abana Estate Sulladjah
products.body_html: Named after the farm’s highest point—at 2,200 meters amidst lush forests and a clear mountain spring—Sulladjah embodies the estate's harmonious connection to its surroundings.

products.title: Guatemala José Fernando López
products.body_html: This lot, our final release of the year from Coopesqui, comes from cooperative member José Fernando López.

products.title: Guatemala Gildardo Pérez
products.body_html: Light and tangy with lush notes of juicy plum, fragrant blackberry, and orange that come together in a vibrant, succulent cup.

products.title: Kenya Muhathi AA 7oz
products.body_html: We are proud to present this coffee, as it embodies the complexity, resilience, and beauty that define Kenyan coffee.

products.title: Kenya Nyamatu AA
products.body_html: This carefully cultivated lot offers vibrant, layered flavors from Blue Mountain, SL-28, and SL-34 varieties.

products.title: Guatemala Milder Velásquez
products.body_html: This exceptional lot was grown by cooperative member Milder Velásquez, whose farm is situated in Huehuetenango within the expansive Cuchumatanes mountain range.

products.title: Honduras Las Virginias Geisha 7oz
products.body_html: The Caballeros have been growing Geisha, the world's most elegant and most celebrated cultivar, since 2012.

products.title: Honduras San Isidro Geisha 7oz
products.body_html: The Caballeros have been growing Geisha, the world's most elegant and most celebrated cultivar, since 2012. However, this particular lot represents the first harvest from an area of the farm known as San Isidro.

products.title: Kenya Konyu AB
products.body_html:
Konyu AB is a fully washed Kenyan coffee grown by farmers who are part of the Kabare Society, which operates 10 factories and has nearly 14,000 members. Farms are located throughout the Kirinyaga region, which is situated just south of Mount Kenya, the second-highest peak in Africa. The coffee varieties grown—SL 28, SL 34, Ruiru 11, and Batian—thrive in the region’s high elevation (around 1,800 meters) and benefit from its nutrient-rich volcanic soil.

Cherries are handpicked and pulped upon delivery to the washing station. Fermentation typically lasts 14-16 hours. Once the mucilage is fully broken down, the coffee is moved to raised beds where it is gently dried over the course of 14-21 days.

products.title: El Salvador Malacara Orange Natural
products.body_html:
Jose Guillermo 'Epe' Alvarez is the fourth-generation owner of Finca Malacara. It is one of the most venerable coffee estates in El Salvador and is located in Santa Ana, one of the most celebrated coffee regions in all of Central America. This lot comes from a selection of the farm's Bourbon trees, which have been cultivated on the farm since it was first established by the Alvarez family in 1888.


In addition to the classic red coffee cherries that most coffee trees produce, some Bourbon trees yield yellow and orange cherries, which are distinct in both color and taste. Harvested from only the Bourbon trees that produce orange cherries, this lot was processed as a natural with the fruit still intact. After harvest, the cherries were rinsed in clean water and carefully dried on raised beds for up to 26 days.

products.title: Brazil Estevão Douro Acauã
products.body_html:
In the highlands of Espírito Santo lies the small town of Marechal Floriano, where Estevão Douro and his family produce coffee on the land where their ancestors first settled after immigrating from Italy to start anew in Brazil. In recent years, with the support of his sons, Denizar and Thiago, Estevão has revitalized the farm by planting new coffee varieties and investing in infrastructure to improve and refine their on-farm processing techniques. This transformation has not only elevated the reputation of their coffee on the international market, but the Douros also offer their own roasted coffee locally.

The farm is home to Acauã, Arara, Catuaí, and Catucaí cultivars, with tomato plants and avocado trees growing alongside them. This particular lot is a selection of Acauã, a hybrid cultivar that has gained popularity in Brazil due to its disease resistance and ability to produce exceptional cup quality. It was sourced from our partners at Osito, who work diligently to discover unique lots from some of Brazil's best smallholder farmers.

products.title: Honduras Caballero Pacamara Natural
products.body_html: Everything about this coffee is big. The Pacamara variety produces big cherries, big seeds, and big flavors, and it was produced by one the biggest names in Honduran coffee: the Caballero family. Having worked with the Caballeros since 2002, we have featured many lots from their award-winning farm, but they never cease to offer something new. This lot marks our first release of the naturally processed Pacamara, which takes the notes of this already fruit-forward cultivar and ups the intensity.

products.title: Kenya Gatina AA
products.body_html:
Kenyan coffees are some of the most expressive in the world. While we often discuss factors like soil, elevation, and rainfall, the frequency of cherry picking and processing protocols are equally important to coffee quality. In Kenya, cherries are picked 1-2 times per week during the harvest, unlike in the Americas where picking generally occurs three times throughout the entire harvest. We believe that this frequent picking, along with meticulous grading protocols, catapults Kenyan coffee into a completely different class of expressiveness.

This Gatina AA lot, which features SL varieties that date back to the 1960s, is a perfect example; it's a showcase of what we love about Kenyan coffees and our first release of the 2024 harvest. The older coffee trees from which this lot was harvested yield less cherry than a younger plant might, but what they lack in yield they make up for in the character of their overall cup profile. The profile is further refined by the AA selection, a designation that requires the beans to be larger and extremely uniform in size and density, representing the highest specialty coffee tier available for export in Kenya.

This lot was processed at the Gatina Coffee Washing Station in Nyeri, which sits at an elevation of 1,700 - 1,800 meters and uses water from the Sagana River. With a member count of 800, they produce coffee from older SL-28, SL-34, Batian, and Ruiru trees planted in red volcanic and black cotton soil.
